snippet: Production rose 0.9 percent last month, the largest gain since November 2014; snow probably contributed to a 3.8 percent decline in housing starts.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports industrial production rose 0.9 percent in January, biggest increase since November 2014.
lead_paragraph: Production rose 0.9 percent last month, the largest gain since November 2014; snow probably contributed to a 3.8 percent decline in housing starts.

headline.main: Industrial Production Jumps, Pointing to Resilience in U.S. Economy
headline.print_headline: Industrial Production Jumps, Pointing to Resilience in U.S. Economy
